intro: Succisa pratensis var. scotiaca, commonly known as Scottish catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in open habitats such as heaths and grasslands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Succisa pratensis var. scotiaca is often found in coastal and upland regions, where it thrives in the cooler, damp climate.
